i want to upgrade my ubuntu from lucid to maverick, how to do it?
go to System -> Admin -> Software sources.  Switch it to normal releases instead of LTS.
Then open the update manager.  There should be a button. The upgrade will take like 1 hr (and it will probably ask you questions)
sudo gives you root for 1 command. If you are already root than you don't need to sudo.  You shouldn't be root generally though.

why it's not a good idea to use root?
It's ok to use it for what you have to.  It is improper to be root all the time because it makes it easier for people to attack you (installing malicious software and such).
It's being root for things that you don't have to that are a problem.  Like running firefox
If you change the name of root you might lose track of who root is
